programme.title: The New Heroic Picture of Thomas Andrews
programme.desc: Every film and every documentary show Thomas Andrews at the end in the first-class smoking room in front of the fireplace staring up at a painting. Kent Layton and his co-authors have uncovered sources that give us a very different account of Mr....

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 2
programme.desc: In the second part of this two-part series, Host Ken Marschall continues his remembrance of his friend Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might...

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: Titanic’s Sunday Night Hymn Sing
programme.desc: The last formal social event on Titanic was the Sunday night hymn sing held in the second class dining saloon. Titanic Channel Host Robert Bracken provides us with new details about how this evening was destined to affect so many lives.

programme.title: The Identity Conspiracy
programme.desc: Was Titanic really swapped with Olympic? It’s a conspiracy theory that just will not die! Parks Stephenson may have the eyewitness accounts that will finally put all the conspiracy talk to rest.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep5 - Navigation
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep5 explains what is at stake in terms of navigation and orienteering

programme.title: Nadelhorn Via Normal Route - The Best Alpine Experience Eng
programme.desc: Cris and Viv are hiking to the summit of Nadelhorn (4,327 m), which lies in the Mischabel group in Switzerland. We follow their adventure from the village of Saas-Fee to the Mischabel Hut, a mountain hut that lies at an elevation of 3,340 meters and that has beautiful views of Lenzspitze, Dom, Nadelhorn, Weissmies, and many other 4000-meter peaks. And finally after having crossed the Hohbalmgletscher, they go over the North-East ridge to get to the summit of Nadelhorn which offers superb views of the Alps and their summits such as the Weisshorn and the famous Matterhorn.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2023 Episode 4
programme.desc: We start this episode in Slovakia for the 2023 Skimarathon European Championship, which coincided with the 50th edition of the renowned Biela Stopa Skimarathon race. We then move to Malaysia for the Northface Malaysia Mountain Trail Festival. We then cross the border from Malaysia to Thailand for another trail running event, the Amazean Jungle Thailand by UTMB! During our previous episode we were introduced to HYROX: the fitness race that is for everybody. It’s the ultimate test, a perfect combination between strength, endurance and determination. We finish with endurance swimming and the UltraSwim 33.3 which is the new global swimming series that will bring the experience to new levels.

programme.title: Rwanda Congo Uganda Bike Adventure - Part 3
programme.desc: Our friend, bikepacker and adventurer, Michele continues his epic 800km solo African bike packing adventure in Rwanda, through Congo and finishing in Uganda. Part 3 of 4 - Republic Democratic of Congo : Gorillas and Volcanoes. Michele left his bicycle for a few days to go to Congo to visit the Virunga National Park. Here he could see the famous mountain gorillas and get to the top of Nyiragongo Volcano (3740m) where he spend the night to admire the lava lake. he also had to be careful and avoid the Ebola pandemia.

programme.title: Marathon des Sables 2023 #7
programme.desc: The last day is traditionnally dedicated to the solidarity stage.Le dernier jour est traditionnellement dédié à létape de solidarité.

programme.title: L'Eroica 2022
programme.desc: LEroica draws its inspiration from classical cycling, from black and white images published on newspapers of the early 1900s to the times of the Bartali and Coppi duel, to more recent times when pedal cages and shifters on the down tube where still the main option on road racing bikes. LEroica chose as a convention 1987 as the year to draw the line between classic cycling and modern times. NOVA Eroica combines gravel, gran fondo and Eroica-style rest stops that encourage riders to Race, Ride and Relax! Open to gravel, road and cx bikes, NOVA celebrates the white roads of Tuscany by combining time trial segments with amazing transfer sections for the thrill of racing and an epic group ride experience.

programme.title: DATEV Challenge Roth 2024
programme.desc: The triathlon in Roth Germany took place again on July 7th 2024. The sports festival in the triathlon stronghold has been home to triathletes from all over the world since 1984. 3.8 km swimming, 180 km cycling and 42.2 km running through the triathlon district of Roth. Emotions and goose bumps are guaranteed, for example at the mythical swim start at the Main-Danube Canal, at the legendary Solar Hill or at the magical finishline party in the triathlon stadium.Le triathlon de Roth en Allemagne a eu lieu à nouveau le 7 juillet 2024. Depuis 1984, la fête sportive du bastion du triathlon accueille des triathlètes du monde entier. 3,8 km de natation, 180 km de cyclisme et 42,2 km de course à pied à travers le quartier du triathlon de Roth. . Les émotions et la chair de poule sont garanties, par exemple lors du départ mythique de la natation au canal Main-Danube, sur la légendaire colline solaire ou lors de la fête darrivée magique dans le stade de triathlon.

programme.title: Titan Desert Saudi Arabia 2024 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Neom Titan Desert Saudi Arabia is an annual mountain biking stage race that attracts participants from all over the world. Here, riders battle not only against the clock, but also against the elements. For the third consecutive year, the race has been part of the Neom Beach Games. Famous athletes such as Peter Sagan, Daniel Oss, Luis Leon Sánchez, Sophie Wright or Tessa Kotekaas are participating this year.

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: A great documentary by Team Joe Barr as they support 59 year old world endurance cyclist Joe Barr as he takes on the solo 1340 mile non stop Race Around Ireland 2018. Joe Barr was the inaugural winner of the Race Around Ireland in 2009. 10 Years later he is back to try again all to raise vital funds for charity.

programme.title: Mauritius International Triathlon 2024
programme.desc: The MIT100 Mauritius International Triathlon is a guilt free, active family ‘fitcation’, balancing race time with play time and down time.Solo racing over 3 distance options (100km PTO ultra, Standard or Sprint) plus midweek swim-run family activities and the option of team format collaboration makes this beautiful and fun experience accessible to everyone from families to friends & corporate teams.

programme.title: Cro Race 2024 Stage 6
programme.desc: Cro Race 2024 Stage 6 : SVETA NEDELJA - ZAGREB

programme.title: Tour of Hellas 2023 Prologue
programme.desc: The 20th ΔΕΗ Tour of Hellas begins with the 6 km-long Prologue, starting and ending at the Karteros Beach Sports Center. A mostly flat course, therefore speed will be a key factor.

programme.title: Italia Yachts 15.98 - Everything you need
programme.desc: The Italia Yachts 15.98 is a complex project that has seen the participation of many minds and hands. There are numerous versions of the interior and the layout has not been defined, the wishes of the owners can be interpreted with the shipyard. If you are seeking a true cruiser suitable for all seas, then the Italia Yachts 15.98 is all you need!

programme.title: Ice Cup 2022 (ENG)
programme.desc: Welcome to the third edition of the Ice Cup, a coastal sailing trip organized by Ice Yachts for the owners of its fast cruisers. Get ready for an exciting weekend of regattas in the Gulf of Tigullio.

programme.title: Contest 50 CS - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Discover the Contest 50 CS, premiering at the Boot alongside its smaller sister. This beautiful bluewater is ideal for demanding navigation in the often stormy North Sea.

programme.title: An habitability beyond its size
programme.desc: Discover the Sun Odyssey 410, built by Jeanneau and designed by Marc Lombard, the architect that defined the geometric and angular lines of this family cruiser. The habitability of this model goes beyond its size of 12 meters, assuring a pleasant sailing and living experience.

programme.title: Jeanneau Yachts 55 Legacy of innovation
programme.desc: Hop on board the Jeanneau 55, presented at the Boot in Dusseldorf. This incredible sailboat is destined to leave a mark, discover why with Antonio Vettese.

programme.title: Arcona 415 Z - Boot 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show brings you to the Boot in Dusseldorf, on board the Arcona 415 Zero Emission. Discover it with Federico Maselli.

programme.title: Beauty and art
programme.desc: The Boat Show welcomes you to Venice, a magical place for those who love beauty and art. Imagine navigating its water: what does the boat of your dreams look like? Could it be like this GV 30 Thunder by Vizianello? This water-limousines or top-of-the-range tender is elegant, practical and built skillfully, sized to resist the wave motion generated by the other boats that navigate this lagoon city.

programme.title: Felci Yacht Design
programme.desc: The Boat Show interviews for you the architect Umberto Felci, one of the most important designers of sailing yachts, founder with the engineer Lorenzo Giovannozzi of Felci Yacht Design, a design and engineering company in the most diverse areas of sailing boats.

programme.title: Best of Boot - 2023
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese and Federico Maselli bring you to the Boot, the International Boat Show in Dusseldorf. Discover the latest trends, the new accessories and technologies.

programme.title: Xenta and Castoldi - Teamwork
programme.desc: Hop on board the Castoldi JT 34 Open Limo and discover a new way of handling your boat. The one you are about to see is equipped with a Castoldi waterjet engine, while the command is from Xenta. Accuracy and safety are guaranteed.

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2022 - Inflatable boats
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is at the Genova Boat Show to present you some of the news inflatable boats at the event. Amongst them: Tecnorib P50, Ranieri International Cayman 45 Cruiser, Zar Formenti 95 Sport Luxury and Marco R26.

programme.title: Miami International Boat Show 2024 - Accessories
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese takes you to discover the most innovative nautical accessories of the Miami International Boat Show 2024. The show is full of innovations and cutting-edge solutions proposed by companies from all over the world.

programme.title: Edoardo Recchi – The interview
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese interviews for you Edoardo Recchi, Sports Director of the Yacht Club Costa Emerald.

programme.title: A multipurpose pick-up
programme.desc: Discover the Isuzu D-Max N60, a heavy work vehicle built in Japan by Isuzu. Specifically, it is a multipurpose new generation pick-up, with a towing capacity of 3.5 Tons. Sturdy, sporty, and with an elegant interior, the D-Max N60 is also ideal for towing your boat.

programme.title: MJM 4 - A strong heritage
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show on board a motor boat with a strong heritage, the MJM4. Peter Johnstone, from MJM Yachts, talks about this incredible boat.

programme.title: How to - Improve your sailing performance
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono shows all the functionality of the Raymarine Axiom 2 Pro and explains how to improve sailing performance with polar poles.

programme.title: Elica Yachts (Eng)
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese takes you to meet Elica Yachts, a company that deals with buying and selling of second-hand yachts up to 40 metres. Experience, competence and professionalism at your disposal.

programme.title: Roxtec (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you behind the scenes of a very successful company. We are talking about Roxtec, world leader in sealing systems for pipe and cable passages.

programme.title: Dockmate (Eng)
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono takes you to discover Dockmate, a real pocket helm station that ensures quick and easy mooring.

programme.title: Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge - Built for cruising
programme.desc: Sam Orani invites you on board the Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge, on show at the Fort Lauderdale International. This is a very social boat, ideal for cruising.

programme.title: Denison Yachting - Miami 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the Miami International Boat Show and she is about to Interview Bob Denison, CEO Denison Yachting.

programme.title: How to - Anchor with Raymarine
programme.desc: Welcome to another appointment with "How to". In this episode Bacci Del Buono explains how to correctly set the alarm for anchoring.

programme.title: Quick SPA
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you inside the Quick SPA factory, a historic leader in excellent nautical components.

programme.title: Silent Yachts Shipyard - Factory Tour
programme.desc: Follow us walking through the factory of the Silent Yachts, where green and sustainable solutions were tested with particular attention to its impact to the environment at the sea.

programme.title: Venmar Lido 32 - Sustainable navigation
programme.desc: Discover a sustainable navigation on board the Venmar Lido 32.

programme.title: UFA 318 - Dynamite Fighting Show 18
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Dynamite Fighting Show 18 from Romania. Starting things off Cosmin Bukoveanu looks to win this rematch when he faces Florin Ivanoaie "Thor" in a heavyweight matchup. Vali Petrut faces Cristian-Gabriel Conea in a heavyweight bout. In the co-main event, Brazilian Rodrigo Mineiro takes on Romanian and hometown favorite Bogdan Nastase and in the main event Flavius Boiciuc faces Andrei Ostrovanu.

programme.title: UFA 316 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) - Rivera vs. Gibson
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting - UNF Rivera versus Gibson from Burbank, CA. Starting things off, Albert Lee faces Bryant Shell then Dion Young and Saad Ul-Hasan are looking to have a quick finish. In the Main Event UFC veterans Francisco Rivera and Cody Gibson fight to become the first Bantamweight UNF Champion.

programme.title: UFA 351-353 - KOK 103 World Series Tallinn
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 103 part 1 from Tallinn, Estonia. Kicking things off tonight Lithuanian Gedminas Justinas takes on Moldovas Sergei Cheles. In back to back female boxing events, Ernesta Kareckaite faces the more experienced Sigrid Kapanen and Aleksandra Dzhikaeva gets in the ring with Karolina Arm. Making his pro debut, Romualdas Auga takes on Aleksandrs Cerkesov. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 103 part 2 from Tallinn, Estonia. In a welterweight Grand Prix, Raimondas Avlasevicius faces Roman Jarysh in the first semi-final fight and in the second semi-final fight Dzianis Makouski joins Marko Sults in the ring with the winner moving on to the Grand Prix finals in the co-main event. Also in this episode, in a very evenly matched bout, Aleh Moshnin and Henry Rohtla face off in the ring. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 103 part 3 from Tallinn, Estonia. In tonights episode in a middleweight bout Richardas Kulis of Lithuania fights Aleksei Larin from Estonia. In a bantamweight championship female fight, Ilona Wojda and Astrid Grents battle it out for the title. Also Ukranian Volodymyr Hynzhu faces Estonias Hendrik Themas.

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: Discovering Central Park's Best Spots
programme.desc: Think you know Central Park? Think again! Fit Tours NYC founder Mike Riordan walks us through 4 secluded areas of the iconic attraction. See his favorites here!

programme.title: Duck de Chine
programme.desc: When you think Beijing, you think ancient history, bustling metropolis and duck. There arent many meals that can claim royal lineage dating back almost a thousand years to the ancient emperors of China. Known as Peking Duck, Beijing Duck or Chinese Roast Duck , this dish is a signature staple of the city and you could spend weeks soul searching and taste testing your way through a variety of recipes (yes, even KFC has one). To save you time, Duck de Chine is one of the annual contenders for the best roast duck in the land and offers an extravagant dining experience. An impressive and inviting décor, complete with vermillion fabrics, dazzling chandeliers, cozy brick walls and large round tables, offers a luxury setting to indulge in the local specialty. Whether you enjoy sugar or spice, a variety of delicious sides accompany the glistening moist meat of this whole duck, prepared over the open flames of 60 year old Jujube wood. Pro tip: dip the crispy skin directly in the raw sugar and enjoy the ride. Smaller dishes, a separate dim sum menu and a full champagne bar are also available so set aside plenty of time to plant yourself in this beautiful dining room and feast away like its 1330.

programme.title: A Writer's Guide to Coffee Shops in NYC
programme.desc: Looking for the best coffee shops in NYC? Whether youre relaxing or getting work done, College Prepster blogger Carly Heitlinger knows New York coffee shops!

programme.title: How To Survive Long-Distance Flights
programme.desc: On this weeks WeHear, we talk about the newest long-distance flights offered & the best mobile apps to help get you through the experience.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Experience Puerto Vallarta
programme.desc: Teri sets off to discover another side of Puerto Vallarta by experiencing luxury at it’s finest at the Casa Velas resort. She also explores the beauty of the vibrant huichol art and statues downtown before taking off for her underwater exploration at Las Caletas in Banderas Bay. Here she encounters sea urchins, sea horses, star fish, pufferfish and more.

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: Dubai's coolest indoor attractions offer a break from the summer heat
programme.desc: Dubai is known for its year-round sunshine and blue skies but sometimes opting for an indoor attraction can offer a break from the heat. This feature of Life takes you on a tour of the best under-cover attractions the city has to offer. The Green Planet One indoor attraction on offer is The Green Planet - a man-made rainforest that is home to over 3000 species of plants and animals. The unique structure is designed specifically to be the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals despite being in the middle of the Dubai desert. There are a range of attractions at the Green Planet - most notably the piranha tank where over 1,000 of the fish are on display. Once a day at 16:00 visitors can see a feeding session . Piranhas are notorious for their razor sharp teeth and carnivorous eating habits. Other attractions include the Australian Walkabout - a multi-species exhibit featuring the Australian carpet python, white tree frogs, the lace goanna lizard residing in an abandoned plane and many more. Housing plants and animals from such a contrasting climate to Dubais requires sophisticated technology. Sara Stevens is the curator of The Green Planet: "The glass for the windows was imported from overseas to be 82 UV penetrable to allow for all those nutrients to come in. Even the misting system is digital and automatic to make sure that if the humidity drops below 80 percent in the building it sprays on every level to provide the perfect environment for all the animals." Sara Stevens said the facility is a chance for young people to learn about conservation first-hand: "It’s one thing to of course learn about conservation in the classroom but it’s another to come here, experience a bird flying by you, a sloth next to you and see where the ginger, vanilla or chocolate that you eat comes from and the plants that are there and then learn how important it is to conserve." iFly Dubai If you have always wanted to experience the feeling of skydiving without having to jump out of a plane or off of a cli

programme.title: Dubai acts to stem the tide of single use plastic
programme.desc: Dubai’s airports have banned all single use plastics as the city works towards a plastic-free future. It comes as the attitude towards single use plastics is changing. In Dubai, 90 per cent of people say they are making a conscious effort to reduce their own plastic waste consumption. Nearly four in five say they recycle more now than they did five years ago. And one in four people say theyre encouraged to recycle more by corporations championing plastic-free initiatives. Dubai International Airport along with Dubai World Central welcome almost 90 million passengers each year. But with those passengers comes 5,500 tonnes of plastic. The airports’ operator, Dubai Airports, banned all single use plastics from inside the terminal at the beginning of this year. That means that plastic cutlery, water bottles, drinking straws, packaging and polythene bags are all banned from cafes and restaurants. Eugene Barry, Dubai Airports’ executive vice president (commercial), told Focus: “Ninety five per cent of our partners have actually made the pledge to switch from plastic to appropriate and relevant substitutes for some of the products that are used in catering and retail across the airport.” The operator hopes its a strategy that might become a template for other major transportation hubs and businesses. “This is very much the early stages of a long journey, I believe, to have a more environmentally friendly approach to managing businesses,” Barry said. Dubai’s 700 hotels are already looking at alternatives, such as switching water bottles from plastic to glass. Plastic key cards could also be a thing of the past, as developers look into switching them to wood-based materials. The eco packaging company Avani is one firm offering plastic-free alternatives, including a bag made from cassava, a cheap and common root vegetable. The material is biodegradable and compostable, breaking down over a period of months on land or at sea. Peter Avram, managing director of Avani Middle East, said: “Until a c

programme.title: Liya Wang
programme.desc: The Story of Liya WangThe “Black Pearl” of Taiwan, supermodel Liya Wang, was nicknamed thus due to her dark, tanned complexion; she perfectly embodies the strong, empowered women at the forefront of the fitness movement today. Looking at her million-watt smile now, little would one have guessed that Liya also went through a dark period in her life. When she won the ELLE Model Look competition back in 2005, at the very height of her career, she bid farewell to the life of glitz and glamour and moved to Shanghai to live a quiet life of marital bliss with her then-newly-wed husband, Lin Yongchao. Just two years into the marriage, the once happy couple divorced and went their separate ways. The period that followed was a downward spiral that Liya finds hard to look back upon even now. Yet, like a phoenix rising from the ashes, she found a new burning passion that reawakened her zest for life - her love of fitness and exercise.Today, Liya has taken time out of her day to tell us her story and recent endeavors. With smooth, sun-kissed skin and minimal make up, Liya flashes us her pearly-whites that remind us of the famous Disney character, Pocahontas. Growing up, becoming a model never crossed Liya’s mind. She perceived her tanned skin and naturally curly hair as against the norm of what was considered aesthetically beautiful, and was naturally surprised when she was approached by a stylist while strolling in Ximending, one of Taipei’s popular shopping districts. The stylist asked her to go in for a casting at Eelin, the model management company in which she is currently still signed to today. As it was Summer break and she had little to do, Liya decided to go to the casting with little expectations, and thus unwittingly began her fifteen-year-long career.It wasn’t all smooth sailing from there, especially the first couple of years into the modelling business. Liya found herself trying to be someone else, fitting into the mold of the successful models before her, afraid to stand out and be herself. Her skin tone, her h

programme.title: Michaela Guzy's World Adventures
programme.desc: Michaela Guzy, who explores the nexus of travel, food, and philanthropy on her website Oh The People You Meet, shares her most memorable travel experiences.

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Jilsiru Tteok Cafe
programme.desc: At first blush, the Jilsiru Tteok Cafe may strike more adventurous explorers as a bit of a snoozefest. Its a cafe attached to an actual Tteok museum (koreans take their rice cakes seriously) inside the old, traditional Insadong neighborhood. Nothing new or trendy but its actually one of those places that you may find yourself wandering back into after your initial bad attitude. The first floor houses the Tteok Cafe where one can essentially purchase and eat every variety of Tteok known to mankind pretty much. The textures and fillings are as varied as the many colors that are on display and its easy to mindlessly go into a tteok-frenzy but it pays to be selective because theres only so much glutinous rice hunks one can eat in one sitting and tteok is known to go stale quickly.When youve had your fill of colorful starch, head up to the 2nd floor where you can find the museum part of the experience and learn about the thousands of years of tteok history. And if youre wanting a little more action after, head on over to the traditional Korean Liquor Museum which is in the same building.In total, this place really is a hub for Koreas days of yore, including spreads on North Korean cuisine and what emperors have been served . Just make sure you come brave enough to try the dried manta ray.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: Things to do in Al Quoz, Dubai’s art hub, home to Alserkal Avenue, artisan cafes and classic cars
programme.desc: Once just an overlooked industrial estate hidden behind the high-rises of Dubai’s Sheikh Zayed Road, Al Quoz is now the beating heart of the citys art scene. Home to Alserkal Avenue – actually a block of streets lined with some of the best art galleries in Dubai – Al Quoz is full of surprises. There’s more than world-class art hidden behind Al Quozs vast landscape of warehouses; where theres art, theres life, after all – and life here is vibrant. Just about every enterprise in Al Quoz comes with an exciting twist; for example, Al Quoz restaurant and speciality coffee bar Café Rider doubles as a custom motorbike store. Mirzam , meanwhile, is an artisan chocolate factory thats also a café, located in the neighbourhood’s central art hub, Alserkal Avenue . Alserkal Avenue cafes are defined by their fair-trade principles and creative concoctions that echo the area’s artistic character. From golden turmeric lattes to immune-boosting vegan matcha bowls, menus are bursting with goodness. Things to do in Alserkal Avenue and neighbouring complex, The Courtyard, include inspiring workshops; there are several to choose between. At Oo La Lab , a fragrance mixology studio in Alserkal Avenue, you can learn how to create your own signature cologne. Or, just across the road, you can join an art class in Dubai’s popular community art space thejamjar . Going strong for 15 years, thejamjar is a regular host of Alserkal Avenue events and art lessons, teaches budding artists of all ages several disciplines, from painting with oils to acrylic techniques. Tilika D’Souza, an art instructor at thejamjar, says the wellbeing of the participants is also important to the foundation: "We have a workshop called Intuitive Creativity that combines meditation and art; we use all kinds of different art materials and we do a little meditation to begin with, so everybody is really relaxed during and after the class." For those who prefer to shop, tempting retail options include independent boutiques, such as Chi-Ka , a

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Where To Indulge in Chicago
programme.desc: Think Chicago is just deep-dish pizza and hot dogs? Lifestyle expert & Chicago native Bahar Takhtechian shares her favorite Chicago restaurants.

programme.title: Flying on water - James O'Hagan tries out the latest addition to the surfing family
programme.desc: It looks like a surfboard, it moves like a surfboard, but its not a surfboard. Its an electric hydrofoil or E-foil. I visited Dubai Marine to have a go at E-foiling myself and find out what makes the activity so thrilling. The man putting me through my paces was Daniel van Dooren, the manager of Ibiza Foils and co-founder of Surf House Dubai . "The thing that makes it different is this hydrofoil wing on the bottom," explained Daniel. "Its got an aeroplane design, which basically lifts you out of the water and gives you that sensation like you’re flying." The E-foils are powered by an electric propeller and controlled remotely via Bluetooth. They can reach speeds of up to 45km an hour. Find out how I got on with my first experience on an E-foil by watching the video above this article. Heres a clue: I wont be giving up my day job anytime soon.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: The Palm Jumeirah: Dubai's symbol of creativity and ambition
programme.desc: Palm Jumeirah is often proclaimed the eighth wonder of the world, a symbol of creativity and ambition. This huge tree-shaped island was built from sand, rock and sheer determination. What keeps it all in place is this 11-kilometer breakwater crescent, lined with five-star hotels, this protective halo has two openings side that allows the famously clear blue waters to flow with the tide. Seventy-eight thousand residents call Palm Jumeirah home, living in luxury apartment blocks on the trunk and private gated estates on the fronds. Its also the address of some of Dubais most exclusive hotel accommodation from Anantaras overwater villas to Atlantiss underwater suites. Elsewhere at Skyline Defining Atlantis, there’s a world-class water park and a network of aquariums filled with 65000 inhabitants. And for a truly surreal experience, you can even walk among them. Or perhaps you prefer to fly? The latest way to get a birds eye view of this manmade megastructure in a gyrocopter. Similar to helicopters, two-seat aircraft reach heights of fifteen hundred feet. Another way to explore Palm Jumeirah is by sea, and the 78-kilometer shoreline is dotted with idyllic seaside destinations. "Club Vista Mare is tucked away on the eastern trunk, very popular destination for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and one ‘star’ attraction of Vista Mare is its pool in the sea," says Rebecca Rees. And the new Palm Tower will showcase a wraparound infinity pool on the 50th floor, providing unparalleled views of this iconic island.

programme.title: Scopa Italian Roots
programme.desc: Scopas airplane hangar-like space in Venice is dominated by a 50-foot bar, communal high-tops, booming acoustics, and a jovial crowd at happy hour. The resulting vibe can only be described as surprisingly pleasant chaos. Bartenders are yelling out NEGRONI orders, servers are dancing around tables to drop Italian cold-cut platters, and diners are leaning in to converse over piles of handmade noodles.About those noodles: Top Chef vet Antonia Lofaso cooks upscale Italian with no fuss, like RIGATONI with vodka sauce and more modern takes like CRESTE RIGATE with morels and English peas. She smears nutty ricotta on ciabatta crostini and then leaves it rightly un-messed-with except for some quality olive oil and fresh parsley. The DEEP-FRIED FLUFFERNUTTER for dessert reminds you that life—and perhaps cardiac health—shouldnt be taken too seriously.

programme.title: Local Food in Puerto Vallarta
programme.desc: Teri explores the local food scene in Puerto Vallarta via a food tour where she eats tacos birria style with meat marinated in goats head, samples the cerviche at Gueros and learns how to drink tequila bandera style.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: The BMX Comedy Jam Bruthas Got Jokes

It’s all in good fun, and in the tradition of great black funny men—from Redd Foxx and Richard Pryor to Dave Chappelle and Chris Rock—who have always dominated the comedy stage!

programme.title: Check Yourself Body Language Boot Camp Workshop II
programme.desc: What do your posture, walk, smile, smirk, punctuality, choice of clothes, and tech tools say about you? And is the message youre sending helpful or more a hindrance? Linda Clemons, CEO of Sisterpreneur, facilities a session to help you self-asses, self monitor, and self-correct so you can consistently project your best-self. Lessons learned from the 2020 Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

programme.title: Continued Coverage from the 2016 Detroit Auto Show Pt 2
programme.desc: We’re back in our continued coverage of the North American International Auto Show in Detroit, Michigan. We talk to Ford Motor Company President & CEO Mark Fields about ownership vs. access to cars in the new millennium. Then we go full speed ahead with BMWs President & CEO Ludwig Willisch, as he describes their turbo-charged Coupe. From there, we get the low down on Infiniti Americas latest luxury sports Coupe from VP Randy Parker. Toyotas North America CEO James Lentz gives us insight on where the brand is going, and why it continues to be the highest-selling car with consumers. And finally, we close the show with Lexuss Group VP & General Manager Jeff Bracken, in front of their newest luxury vehicle with the ticket price of $100,000.

programme.title: How Black Leaders Are Creating Equity in America hosted by Capital One

programme.title: Preparing For The Cost To Be The Boss

programme.title: Nature's Abstracts
programme.desc: This 2 hour moving art film immerses you in the wondrous abstract patterns found in nature through the fine art photography of Elizabeth Carmel.

programme.title: Preview of "Hawaii, A Journey Through The Big Island"
programme.desc: Experience Big Island bliss in the stunning 2 hour film, available for streaming on May 16. Soar above waterfalls that plunge into the Pacific, kick back with views of beach sunsets and slow motion waves, enjoy island palms in the gentle island breezes, and experience the Waipio valley paradise from above. Dazzling cinematography is accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack. Available at www.NatureStream.tv. Run time 2 hours.

programme.title: Preview of Matted Art Displays
programme.desc: This is a preview of a series of 15 of Elizabeth Carmels Fine Art Photographs matted like framed art pieces.The full 2 1/2 hour film displays each photograph for 10 minutes. To remain on one photograph press pause, follow the directions in our video "Displaying Fine Art Photographs on Your Apple TV and Roku.

programme.title: Journey Through the Lofoten Islands
programme.desc: Visit the spectacular Lofoten Islands of northern Norway in this relaxing nature film. Soar above the mystical peaks that plunge into the ocean, and enjoy the quaint villages that dot the remote shorelines of the fjords. The full film is 90 minutes in length and available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Ariana Grande vs. Pete Davidson
programme.desc: S1:E11 What made Kanye West go to war against Pete Davidson? Kanye is relentlessly going after Pete, so much so, that Kim Kardashian is concerned about the safety of her new boyfriend. Is it because Kanye knows Pete’s history of controversial relationships? Our team got the real story behind the tabloids, the truth behind Pete’s behavior in relationships, and the journey he went on to truly start loving who he is.

programme.title: Rihanna vs. Chris Brown.
programme.desc: S1:E1 Rihanna found herself the victim of assault, from her best friend and then-boyfriend, Chris Brown. Not only was she humiliated in front of the world, but she also faced further attacks from the media, some going as far as claiming the violence was her fault. We uncovered the real story of Rihanna’s experience during and after the incident, not the one portrayed by the media, where she shows us why she is the strong, compassionate, graceful woman the world fell in love within the first place.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Katy Perry vs. Russell Brand
programme.desc: S1:E7 Katy Perry is no stranger to toxic relationships. She finally thought she landed the perfect one with bad boy comedian Russell Brand, only for him to divorce her through text message right in the middle of her world tour 2 years later. Our team uncovered the full story of the turbulent aftermath and the journey she went on to become a strong, authentic person who was finally able to fully embrace a healthy relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Rocky NoHands
programme.desc: S1:E4 How would you feel if you lost in Fortnite to one of the worlds best players, and found out he was using his mouth as a controller? RockyNoHands is a professional eSports Fortnite player, making a career of playing a video game he loves and being among the best in the world at it. After the darkest moment of Rocky’s life left him paralyzed and motionless in a hospital bed, doctors told him he may never walk again. It wasn’t until a source of pure motivation forced him to dig deep to find his unbreakable drive, that he was able to take on his biggest and most rewarding challenge yet.

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: The Dark Side of Elon Musk
programme.desc: Elon Musk, founder of SpaceX and CEO of Tesla, always found it hard fitting in with others. Hiding his painful secrets - Elon threw himself into his work, amassing huge success as an entrepreneur. But when he got caught up in the middle of a messy divorce with Amber Heard, Elon’s worst fears were realized and he hit a severe breaking point.

programme.title: Real Stories With Wim Hof
programme.desc: In this bonus exclusive Goalcast interview, find out what Wim Hofs mother said to him at a very young age that drives every move he makes. Wim Hof is a world record breaker and a global phenomenon. He is famous for his superhuman ability to perform extreme long-distance swimming under freezing water. But the Iceman believes he has a special calling in the world.

programme.title: Muggsy Bogues A Giant On The Court
programme.desc: Muggsy Bogues is the shortest man in NBA history at only 5 ft 3. He’s also one of the best basketball players of all time. Coming from a rough neighbourhood where he was shot at by the age of 5, no one believed in him. He was bullied and mocked because of his height, yet today, he’s got some of the best basketball dunks ever seen. Now, everyone wonders: hows that possible? How did he even make it to the NBA? This is Muggsy’s story: a true underdog who had all the odds against him.

programme.title: Rise Above Shame
programme.desc: Iyanla Vanzants husband mistreated her for years -- threatening their children and trapping her with fear of greater violence. She shares how she found the strength to leave and escape the cycle.

programme.title: Kevin Berthia The Golden Gate Bridge Guardian Angel
programme.desc: Kevin Berthia tells the true story of how the power of listening and hope saved him from the darkest moment of his life on the Golden Gate Bridge.

programme.title: Alicia Kozakiewicz Friend or Predator
programme.desc: At just 13 years old, Alicia Kozakiewicz stepped outside her family home and into every parent’s worst nightmare. She’d agreed to meet the “friend” with whom she’d been chatting online for six months, but by the time she realized this man was a deranged predator, it was too late. How did she manage to stay alive? And what traumatic lesson does Alicia want all parents and teens to hear?

programme.title: Paul de Gelder Saved by Sharks
programme.desc: In 60 years, no one had been attacked by a shark in Sydney Harbour... Until one day, it happened to Navy diver Paul de Gelder! How did he survive? What drove him to fight for his life?

programme.title: The Dark Past Of Funny Man Tyler Perry
programme.desc: Tyler Perry stepped into the limelight with his character, Madea. He played a hilarious, tough-love woman who shared countless lessons on self-esteem, respecting yourself, and staying strong. Behind the scenes though, Tyler lived a life of bitterness and rage. There was one person he couldn’t forgive and it nearly cost him everything.

programme.title: Chanel Miller Write Your Own Story
programme.desc: As the press called her Emily Doe & his legal team tried to frame her assailant Brock Turner as the "star athletes with everything to lose," Chanel Miller remained anonymous. What pushed her to break her silence during the final days of Turners trial? And how did her powerful statement about her sexual assault give a voice to survivors around the world?

programme.title: Mia Kang The Woman That I Am
programme.desc: Overweight as a child, Mia Kang suffered bullying and a far from ideal childhood. Desperate to lose weight and feel good about herself, Mia began starving herself at the young age of 13. She lost a lot of weight very quickly and this launched her into the modeling industry which continued to destroy her self-esteem and health, until a vacation in Thailand, and her discovery of Muay Thai changed her life forever.

programme.title: Jason Reid Tell my Story
programme.desc: Jason Reid faced every parent’s worst nightmare when his son Ryan died by suicide at the age of 14. The tragedy lit a fire in him to end teen suicide by 2030. Fathers NEED To Change NOW. In this Goalcast Original, Jason Reid and a group of fathers have an intense conversation about teen suicide. Jason shares his heartfelt story as well as crucial parenting advice that can have life-saving consequences. Witness the power of vulnerability and discover simple ways you can transform your relationship with your kids by giving them the tools to thrive in life.

programme.title: Win Against all Odds
programme.desc: Homesick, bankrupt, and father-less, young Dan Lok was devastated when he arrived home one day to find his mom in tears. His riveting coming-of-age story will inspire you to put your best foot forward every single day.

programme.title: Inspiration
programme.desc: "Inspiration in business plays a crucial role in driving innovation, motivation, and long-term success. It acts as a catalyst that encourages entrepreneurs and teams to think creatively, overcome obstacles, and pursue their goals with passion. Whether drawn from personal experiences, mentors, or the vision of creating something new, inspiration fuels the perseverance needed to navigate the challenges of the business world.Jeanniey is joned by experts to help viewers evolve and thrive in a constantly changing landscape."

programme.title: Pursuing Your Passion
programme.desc: "Jeanniey Walden helps you pursue your passion with advice from the entrepreneur expert and TV star himself, Kevin OLeary, cook up a holiday feast with Chef George Duran and get inspired by Ed Begley JR"

programme.title: 4 Reasons You Should NOT Do a Roth Conversion
programme.desc: Roth conversions can be a wonderful tool. When used inappropriately, it can do more harm than good. Here are 4 instances where you should NOT do a Roth Conversion.

programme.title: Root Financial Why a Monte Carlo simulation is not a plan
programme.desc: In this episode, youll learn why a Monte Carlo analysis is not a financial plan. A Monte Carlo analysis can be helpful starting tool when thinking about retirement, but in my opinion, it doesnt touch on a few of the most important aspects of retirement planning.

programme.title: Social Security Changes That Could Hurt Your Finances in 2024
programme.desc: Stay ahead in 2024 with the latest Social Security updates, brought to you by Marvin Musick from Medicare School. Marvin discusses the key changes in Social Security for the year, including the new Cost of Living Adjustment (COLA) of 3.2. Wondering how this compares to last years 8.7? Marvins got you covered! This is for anyone who is looking to understand how these changes impact their financial planning. Next, Marvin shows you the critical adjustments to the earnings test limits for 2024. If youre considering taking your Social Security benefits early, youll want to pay close attention to this. Learn about the new earnings caps - $2,320 and $59,500 - and how they might affect your benefits if youre still working. Plus, Marvin discusses the increase in taxable income limits for Social Security taxes.

programme.title: Episode 5 Will Medicare Cover All My Expenses
programme.desc: Marvin goes over if Medicare will cover all your expenses and in the second half of the show go over one of the most common questions he hears, can Medicare plans drop you from coverage.

programme.title: Career Advice
programme.desc: Jeanniey Walden discusses how you can manage your career and stand out in your job search. Guests include Sanya Richards Ross and Bryan Baumler.

programme.title: What Should You Do with Your 401k When You Retire
programme.desc: If youre close to retirement, one crucial aspect to consider is what to do with your hard-earned 401k savings. This decision requires careful thought and planning, as it can significantly impact your financial well-being in the long run.

programme.title: Saschiz Old Town, Romania
programme.desc: Saschiz, village, and commune, Mureș județ county is located in central Romania. The villages of Saschiz, Mihai Viteazu, and Cloașterf make up the larger commune of Saschiz. Located in the old region of Transylvania, it lies about 20 km east of Sighișoara"&". First documented in the 14th century, Saschiz is known for its medieval fortress and church constructed by Transylvanian Saxons, a German speaker. They settled in Transylvania when it was part of Hungary. The ruins of the 14th-century fortress sit atop "&"a hill overlooking the village. The late 15th-century fortified church has Gothic details and an imposing clock tower. Along with five other villages with fortified churches, Saschiz was inscribed on UNESCO’s World Heritage sites in 1999.

programme.title: Bitcoin Jesus: The Prosecution of Roger Ver
programme.desc: They call him “Bitcoin Jesus,” though he despises the nickname. His real name is Roger Ver. At any moment, Roger could be arrested for alleged tax evasion and mail fraud. But anyone familiar with his case knows the truth: Roger’s only “crime” was being the very first investor and passionate advocate for Bitcoin. For that, he faces 109 years in federal prison. As devastating as this is for Roger, this case is less about him and more about you.

EDEN systems convert mixed carbon based waste into: • clean electricity • clean fuels • bio and hydrochar for soil • recoverable grey water
Waste is no longer a liability, it is now an asset. The solution to pollution is here and EDEN will be restored.

programme.title: Beyond the Headlines: Bitcoin on S&P 500?

programme.title: Stars

Artist Franz Spohn creates watercolor paintings featuring clouds. Jenny makes a suncatcher mandala and Candie Cooper captures a sparkly space galaxy in a bottle.

programme.title: Wire Wrapping Variations
programme.desc: Using new innovations and traditional techniques, inventor Wyatt White presents ideas for wrapping different types of wire to create a setting for a cameo cabochon. Using both vintage and new buttons, Wyatt shows how to shape wire to make rings and earrings. Katie shows how to stitch beads onto braided leather.

programme.title: Torch-Fired Enameling
programme.desc: Metal artist Mary Hettmansperger demonstrates torch-fired enameling and how to create three dimensional surfaces. She also shares tips for cutting metal. Then, enjoy an online visit with author and teacher Kate Richbourg from her studio with advice for caring for and cleaning your tools.

programme.title: Episode 4: Family
programme.desc: Sweeten favorite family photos. Cheryl Boglioli goes beyond the frame by adding tags to framed photos and then shares a special tip. Ashley Horton creates a fun page for her sister. Amy Tan preserves special family memories with artistic techniques the whole family can enjoy together.

programme.title: Episode 4: Nature
programme.desc: Nature is all encompassing from animals to insects, plants and seasons, and weather and rocks. First host Julie Fei Fan Balzer shows a new way to screen print right at home and make a flying pig stuffed toy. Then Joe Rotella shows how to make a wood honeycomb niche wall shelf. Nature's patterns are reproduced in your home. Finally, it's another lesson with Tori Weyers entitled the color of seasons, and how to create color palettes using the seasons where you live.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show

programme.title: MISS SOUTH PACIFIC: BEAUTY AND THE SEA

The entire world has a responsibility to reverse the tide before Pacific Islanders are swallowed up by the sea.

programme.title: Interview with K.R.Vatsala | Thirumathi Selvam
programme.desc: Welcome to Tele Vikatan, your one-stop destination for everything television! Get ready to immerse yourself in the captivating world of TV shows, exclusive interviews, soap opera reviews, and more. Our dedicated team is here to bring you the latest updates and behind-the-scenes insights from the exciting realm of television. Discover the thrill of your favorite television dramas as we delve into their gripping storylines and unforgettable characters. Join us as we go beyond the screen to explore the lives of your beloved TV stars through exclusive interviews, where they share their experiences, anecdotes, and behind-the-scenes stories. At Tele Vikatan, we are passionate about delivering high-quality content that caters to the diverse tastes and interests of our viewers. Whether youre a fan of heartwarming family dramas, thrilling mysteries, or gripping romance, we have something for everyone. We provide you with informative and entertaining videos that enhance your TV viewing experience. With Tele Vikatan, youll never miss a moment of the television magic.

programme.title: Ananda Vikatan Cinema Awards 2016
programme.desc: Ananda Vikatan Cinema Awards is an annual awards ceremony for people in the Tamil film industry. It is presented by the Tamil language weekly magazine Ananda Vikatan. The awards were introduced in the year 2008, honouring the films that were released in 2007.

programme.title: Five things you should do right now to live a healthy life!
programme.desc: This series caters to fashion, beauty, skincare, and lifestyle enthusiasts. It offers diverse content, including skincare & makeup tutorials, fashion tips, lifestyle vlogs, and exclusive interviews with celebrities about their lifestyles. Our team of experts strives to provide the latest trends and advice in the beauty and fashion industry to help our viewers look and feel their best. With Say Swag, you can expect high-quality content that is entertaining and informative, bringing you closer to your favorite celebrities and their unique lifestyles. Join us to discover the latest and greatest in fashion, beauty, and lifestyle.

programme.title: Naayagi Episode 47
programme.desc: Nayagi is a 2018 Indian Tamil-language Family Drama series. It premiered on 19 February 2018 on Sun TV, replacing Deivamagal, and was replaced by Anbe Vaa and it ended on 31 October 2020. The show was produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S Kumaran. Nayagi was also re-aired on Kalaignar TV from 1 March 2021 and it ended its run on 9 July 2022 Plot Anandhi, a middle-class woman, struggles to keep her life together while dealing with an alcoholic father and his debts. Though her landlady Sargunam is formidable, she wishes to destroy Kalivardhan.

programme.title: Welcome to the world of Automated Irrigation
programme.desc: A show that touches the lives of millions of farmers across Tamilnadu and helps them grow.

programme.title: """I wish not to quit Dravidian movements!"" - Kovai Selvaraj opens up."
programme.desc: Kovai Selvaraj shared audio announcing his resignation from ADMK. He accused EPS and OPS of fighting each other for their self-interests. He also said he has no interest in working with either of them. He added that he is not willing to give up on Dravidian ideologies.

programme.title: Deivamagal Episode 40
programme.desc: Deivamagal is an Indian Tamil-language soap opera starring Vani Bhojan and Krishna. It was broadcast on Sun TV initially from Monday to Friday and later extended to Saturday at 8 PM from 25 March 2013 to 17 February 2018 for 1,466 episodes. The show replaced S. Kumarans successful soap, Thirumathi Selvam, and replaced by Nayagi. The show is produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S. Kumaran. This serial was shot in Pollachi, Chennai, Chengalpet, Hyderabad, Kerala, Puducherry, and Cuddalore. This is the first TV serial shot in the Bay of Bengal Plot Prakash his wife Sathyapriya and his eldest sister-in-law Gayathris conspiracies against their families to conquer Prakshs ancestral property Jai Hind Vilas.
